intro: Strongyleria pellipes, commonly known as the green alder. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Betulaceae, native to parts of Europe and Asia. This plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and along stream banks. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
